items.title: ABC drops Roseanne show after racist tweet
items.description: The comedian tried to explain away the tweet as a "joke", but ABC called it "repugnant".
items.content: The comedian tried to explain away the tweet as a "joke", but ABC called it "repugnant".

items.title: Nicaragua unrest: Government colluding with mobs, says Amnesty
items.description: Amnesty International accuses Nicaragua's government of using armed groups to suppress protesters.
items.content: Amnesty International accuses Nicaragua's government of using armed groups to suppress protesters.

items.title: Russia's opposition journalist Arkady Babchenko shot dead in Kiev
items.description: Arkady Babchenko, a critic of the Kremlin, was shot near his home in Kiev, Ukraine's police say.
items.content: Arkady Babchenko, a critic of the Kremlin, was shot near his home in Kiev, Ukraine's police say.

items.title: Germany and Turkey mark Solingen deadly racist attack
items.description: Politicians from both countries remember five women and girls killed in a neo-Nazi firebombing in 1993.
items.content: Politicians from both countries remember five women and girls killed in a neo-Nazi firebombing in 1993.

items.title: Liege shooting: Two police officers and civilian dead in Belgium
items.description: Two female police officers are among the dead in an attack being treated as a terror incident.
items.content: Two female police officers are among the dead in an attack being treated as a terror incident.

items.title: Israel strikes Gaza after heaviest mortar barrage in years
items.description: Dozens of militant sites are hit after mortars are launched at Israel, hitting a kindergarten.
items.content: Dozens of militant sites are hit after mortars are launched at Israel, hitting a kindergarten.

items.title: Italy political crisis hits financial markets
items.description: Fears over political unrest in Italy spread to Wall Street after Europe's main markets close lower.
items.content: Fears over political unrest in Italy spread to Wall Street after Europe's main markets close lower.

items.title: Missouri Governor Eric Greitens resigns amid sex scandal
items.description: The former Navy Seal has been under criminal investigation this year and faces impeachment.
items.content: The former Navy Seal has been under criminal investigation this year and faces impeachment.

items.title: Hurricane Maria 'killed 4,600 in Puerto Rico'
items.description: A Harvard estimate puts the number of deaths at more than 70 times the official toll of 64.
items.content: A Harvard estimate puts the number of deaths at more than 70 times the official toll of 64.

items.title: EU tightens law on foreign temporary workers
items.description: Workers posted to another EU country will have to get local pay and conditions.
items.content: Workers posted to another EU country will have to get local pay and conditions.
